my_functions.find_and_concatenate_sequences(sequence_list, max_length, num_sequences)Â¶

Find and concatenate sequences to form larger sequences with specified constraints. This function creates overlaps between the final assembled sequences. Each overlap is one initial fragment.

Parameters:

  • sequence_list (list) â€“ List of dictionaries containing sequence information.

  • max_length (int) â€“ Maximum allowed length for concatenated sequences.

  • num_sequences (int) â€“ Number of concatenated sequences to generate.

Returns:

A concatenated sequence and a list of lists containing combined sequence IDs.

Return type:

tuple

app.generate_reports(df, index, domesticated_paths, backbones_paths)Â¶

Generate an assembly report from a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) â€“ The DataFrame containing the assembly data.

  • index (int) â€“ Index of the DataFrame in the list for report naming.

  • domesticated_paths (list of str) â€“ Paths to domesticated fragment files.

  • backbones_paths (list of str) â€“ Paths to backbone files.

Returns:

None

Raises:

Exception â€“ If an error occurs during the report generation process.

Notes

The function modifies the recognition sites for certain enzymes if â€˜omegaâ€™ is present in the part name to work around a limitation in the DNA cauldron assembly process.
